Class SingleGroupManager

java.lang.Object

All Implemented Interfaces:
DeletableManager, IManager
public class SingleGroupManager
extends SingleTypeManager<Group>
implements DeletableManager

Manages a group object, deals with syncing to the server.

Constructor Detail

SingleGroupManager

SingleGroupManager(java.lang.String name,
                   boolean nGroup)
This should only ever be used inside group manager. We do not ever want to manually create an instance of this class.

Parameters:
name - Group that this manager controls.
nGroup - Is this a manager for a new group or an already created one?
Method Detail

requestDeletion

public void requestDeletion()
Description copied from interface: DeletableManager
After calling this, the manager will delete its object on the next push.

Specified by:
requestDeletion in interface DeletableManager

pendingDelete

public boolean pendingDelete()
Description copied from interface: DeletableManager
Check if the object has been deleted. When this returns true, other manager getters and setters may not work.

Specified by:
pendingDelete in interface DeletableManager
Returns:
true if this manager is waiting to delete its object, Or if it has already been deleted.
